result.execSummary:
The defendant Roger B. Holzem was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: (from 22CM677; DRI) to be paid to Menards.
GFE at FTE/schooling/combination of the two of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours community service per week.
Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances/alcohol except prescribed medications taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization.

AODA.  Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by agent.  

DNA sample.  

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Roger B. Holzem

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Case Called: 9:36 a.m.
Clerk: Nicole.
INCLUDES: 22CF876, 22CM677.
State appears by DA Rory McGarry. Defendant appears in person with Atty Kat Yanke.

Date and Time Set for a Final Pre-Trial.
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.

Parties discuss veteran's treatment court.

State moves to
22CM677>>DRI.
COURT grants above.

State moves to
22CF876>>>DRI Count 3. 
COURT grants above.

PLEA: 
COUNT 1 (Retail theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5,000 - Repeater)>>NO CONTEST.
COUNT 2 (Resisting or Obstructing an Officer - Repeater)>>NO CONTEST.

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made: a factual basis & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: COUNT 1: SWH for 3 years probation - CONDITIONS: AODA; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances/alcohol except prescribed medications taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization; DNA sample/surcharge; CC. Restitution from case 22CM677 paid to Menards in the amount of $343.95 plus 10 percent surcharge; good faith effort at fulltime employment/school/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week. 36 days jail credit if revoked. 

COURT ORDERS: COUNT 2: SWH for 1 year probation - CONDITIONS: AODA; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances/alcohol except prescribed medications taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization; good faith effort at fulltime employment/school/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; DNA sample/surcharge; CC. 36 days jail credit if revoked.

Adj: 9:51 a.m.
(Mins updated 10/31/22 @ 10:13 a.m. - nm)
Re: Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum
